revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/93.110.13.247|93.110.13.247]]. If you think this rollback is in error, please leave a message on my [[User talk:Surjection|talk page]].
revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{compound|en|year|tide|t2=time, occasion}}. Compare {{cog|fy|jiertiid|t=season}}, {{cog|nl|jaartijd}}, {{m|nl|jaargetijde||season}}, {{cog|de|Jahreszeit||season}}, {{cog|sv|årstid||season}}, {{cog|is|árstíð||season}}, {{cog|yi|יאָרצײַט}}. {{doublet|en|yahrzeit}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|mostly|fantasy}} A specific [[time]] of [[year]]; [[season]]. #* '''1907''', Union of American Hebrew Congregations, ''Young Israel'': #*: {{...}} And promised whatever the '''yeartides''' would bring To this wish of his friend he would fervently cling. #* '''1958''', American Jewish Congress, ''Judaism'': #*: Or phylacteries on skulls unyielding, While our river of days flows dark With a '''yeartide''' of days, a '''yeartide''' of nights Unhallowed, unhallowed? #* '''1985''', Percy Grainger, Kay Dreyfus, ''The farthest north of humanness'': #*: Peter & 2-Js & I joined in a flower bunch, besides which I also sent her a 15 bob sheaf on my own, with gum-leafage — the sole homish stuff havable here at this '''yeartide''' — there among. # {{lb|en|rare|nonstandard}} A specific time each year; [[anniversary]]. #* '''1921''', Emma Kenyon Parrish, ''The golden island'': #*: A-dream, we rock at home. So, lasting-sweet is sleep : With sails forever furled. Forgot is all the world, And soft the '''yeartides''' creep : O sweet, O lasting sleep! #* '''2006''', Gene Wolfe, ''The Wizard: Book Two of The Wizard Knight'': #*: There will be a tourney in three days, as always at '''Yeartide'''. You could enter those events at which you may excel.
